result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel D Navin

records.addlTxt:
1:32 PM Defendant Samuel D Navin in court.  Attorney Brandon S for Jonathan A. LaVoy in court for Samuel D Navin.  Attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 

Matter was scheduled as a competency hearing. 
Comp evaluation received/reviewed by parties. Defendant is competent. Defense does not contest findings and is ready to proceed to plea. 

BTC: Defendant is competent to proceed.

CASE# 22CM60
Plea - GUILTY: AMENDED CT 2: DC AND CT 3 
BTC: GUILTY. CT 1: DRI

Withheld Sentence
1 year probation; 
If revoked; 5 days credit for time served RCJ

Conditions of probation:
No alc;
No c/s except by Rx; must take medication as prescribed
DND
AODA;
Counseling;
Mental Health Assessment
Ft employment and/or schooling
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
cc+ DNA assessment + DAA surcharge

records.addlTxt: State's NOI to Intro Recorded Statements
State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No violent contact with the victim P.N and R.N (person, property, residence or family). Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.

1:44 PM Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Samuel D Navin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal appeared by video for Samuel D Navin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Victim appears via zoom
Defense raises competency concerns.
State indicates the defendant has been found competent to proceed in a pending file
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set. 
BTC: Court orders a competency examination.
Competency hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Competency hearing on May 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Initial appearance on April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
